title: ponies: generics using .(type)
body:
by **Ryan.FireBall**: 
It might be advisable to use the ".(type)" syntax over the reflect library,
reflect.Type, and etc.

For example:

func main () {
 var a int
 var b type
 a = 9
 b = a.(type)
 c := make(map[b]int)
 c[a] = 2
}

Possibly use .(type[0]) or variant for maps? The program could invisibly check for and
panic on type mismatch.

Just an idea.
